requirements.summary: Deliver a cohesive, premium storefront theme with responsive layout and consistent UI styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Storefront pages use one coherent theme (no mismatched styles)
Layout is responsive for mobile/tablet/desktop
User-facing text is in English

file_operations.description: Create global styles entry to establish a consistent theme foundation (typography scale, spacing rhythm, background/foreground, link/button defaults) aligned with Tailwind + shadcn/ui tokens. Use the shadcn-ui component library styling conventions for consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Refine Tailwind theme settings (container, extended colors/typography, responsive breakpoints usage guidance) to support a premium, consistent storefront look across pages.

Create a reusable layout wrapper that applies consistent page structure (header, main container, footer) and responsive spacing. Compose shadcn-ui primitives for consistent layout building blocks. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement complete storefront page architecture and navigation for Home, Catalog, Product Detail, Cart, Checkout (mock), and Contact.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation links to Home, Catalog, Cart, and Contact are present and functional
Product Detail pages are accessible from the catalog
Cart page shows selected items and totals
Checkout is present and clearly marked as a mock/demo (no real payment processing)

file_operations.description: Create the app shell and route wiring for Home, Catalog, Product Detail, Cart, Checkout, and Contact. Ensure all routes render within StoreLayout and are reachable via navigation.
Create Home page view container and wire to StoreLayout; keep copy in English and align styling with the global theme.

Create Product Listing (catalog) page with a grid layout, filter/sort controls, and links to Product Detail routes. Compose shadcn-ui components for inputs, selects, and cards. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Product Detail page view with product image, title, price, description, category, optional rating, and add-to-cart CTA; ensure it is navigable from catalog.
Create Cart page view showing cart items, quantity controls, remove actions, and computed totals; include a clear path to Checkout.
Create mock Checkout page UI (no payment) with a clear demo disclaimer, order summary, and a non-functional 'Place Order' action suitable for template resale.
Create Contact page view containing business email display and contact form UI (wired to backend submission per REQ-4).

requirements.summary: Add a prominent branding header with static logo placement and a clean search bar UI that works well on mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: Header includes a visible logo area (renders an image from static assets)
Header includes a search input (frontend filtering of catalog is acceptable)
Header remains usable on mobile (collapses appropriately)

file_operations.description: Implement a responsive storefront header with a logo image loaded from generated assets, primary navigation links, cart link/indicator, and a search input. Compose shadcn-ui components (e.g., input, button, sheet/dropdown) for a polished, mobile-friendly header. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the new Header into the global layout so it appears consistently on all storefront pages.
Add lightweight shared state utilities (URL query param helpers or context) to keep the header search input synchronized with the catalog filtering experience.

requirements.summary: Provide visible business email and a validated contact form UI that submits inquiries via backend function calls.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer and/or Contact page displays a business email address field/section
Contact form includes at least name, email, and message fields with validation
Submitting the form creates an inquiry that is persisted in the backend and can be retrieved via a backend query method

file_operations.description: Create a footer that includes a visible business email section and consistent secondary navigation styling. Compose shadcn-ui typography primitives for a clean premium footer. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the Footer into the global layout so the business email is visible site-wide.

Implement a contact form UI with name, email, and message fields, client-side validation, and submit/reset states. Use shadcn-ui form-related components for consistent UX. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Render business email display and the ContactForm component; on submit, call the backend submitInquiry capability via the frontend backend client wrapper using React Query.
Add a small service layer that exposes 'submit inquiry' and optional 'fetch inquiry' calls through the existing backend interface, designed to be used with React Query (mutations/queries).

requirements.summary: Display up to 100 products with images and metadata, providing catalog grid plus filtering and sorting UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to list products and get product details
Frontend catalog supports displaying up to 100 products without layout breaking
Each product card shows an image, title, and price at minimum
Catalog includes at least one filter (e.g., category) and one sort option (e.g., price)

file_operations.description: Create product data access utilities that call the backend getProducts capability and provide helpers for client-side filtering/sorting for up to 100 items (category filter and price sort).

Create a polished product card showing product image, title, and price (and optionally rating/category) with a link to Product Detail. Compose shadcn-ui card/button primitives. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a responsive product grid component optimized for up to 100 products without layout breaking, including loading/empty states (React Query-friendly).

Create filtering/sorting UI controls (category filter + price sort) and integrate with header search term if present. Use shadcn-ui select/input components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire React Query product list loading, render CatalogControls + ProductGrid, and ensure product detail navigation works from each ProductCard.
Load product data from React Query product list (or fetch/derive from cached list) and render full product detail with image and metadata.

requirements.summary: Seed a curated set of 100 demo products referencing local generated images, ensuring the catalog is populated on first run without external services.
acceptanceCriteria: A first-time deploy shows a populated catalog with 100 products
Product images load from frontend static assets
No dependency on external databases or external image hosting is required to view the demo catalog

file_operations.description: Add curated placeholder demo product dataset (100 items) with titles, categories, descriptions, prices, optional ratings, and imageUrl fields that reference local generated assets under frontend/public/assets/generated (reusing the provided product-01..product-10 images across the 100 products).

Implement a frontend seeding routine that, on first load, calls backend initializeDemoProducts and/or addProduct using the 100 demo products, guarded by a client-side flag to avoid repeated seeding; designed for use with React Query and safe to run without external dependencies.

Wire the demo seeding routine to run on initial app mount (or first Home/Catalog visit) so first-time deploy shows a populated catalog; keep the user experience smooth with a non-blocking loading indicator.

requirements.summary: Implement shopping cart behavior: add items, adjust quantity, remove items, and compute subtotal/estimated totals.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can add a product to the cart and see it appear in Cart page
Users can change quantities and see totals update
Users can remove items from the cart

file_operations.description: Create a CartProvider (React Context) with cart state, actions (add/update/remove/clear), derived totals, and localStorage persistence so the cart survives refresh.
Wrap routed pages with CartProvider so cart state is available across Header, Product Detail, and Cart pages.
Wire 'Add to cart' CTA to CartProvider actions; optionally include quantity selector prior to adding.
Optionally support quick-add to cart from product cards while keeping UX clean and premium.
Implement quantity adjustment controls, remove actions, and subtotal/estimated total calculations; ensure totals update immediately.
Show cart entry point in the header (link and item count indicator) and ensure it remains usable on mobile.

requirements.summary: Create a polished Home page with hero, featured collections, and featured products using generated imagery.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page contains a hero banner area, at least one featured category/collection section, and a featured products section
Featured products link to their Product Detail pages
Hero and/or category visuals use generated static assets

file_operations.description: Create a hero section that renders the generated hero banner image and premium English copy with clear CTAs to the catalog. Compose shadcn-ui button/typography components for a polished look. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create featured category/collection tiles using generated category images and links to the catalog with category pre-filter applied.
Create a featured products section showing a curated subset of products (from React Query product list) and linking to Product Detail pages. Reuse ProductCard for visual consistency.
Compose HeroSection, FeaturedCategories, and FeaturedProducts into a cohesive responsive Home page that matches the overall theme and uses generated imagery.

requirements.summary: Add and render required generated static images (logo, hero, categories, and product images) from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated
Header logo renders from the generated assets path
Home hero renders from the generated assets path
Products render images from the generated assets path (direct static file references)

Render the hero banner from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.dim_1600x600.png and ensure responsive cropping/contain behavior aligns with the theme.
